Title.Language: The Liturgy of Blessing of the Water of the Apostles' Feast

Comment.Language: Priests and deacons prepare the basin on which the Liturgy of the Waters is to be prayed in the back of the Church.
During the entrance of the Pope or a metropolitan or a bishop in to the church, the following may be said:

Text.Language: Meet and right, meet and right, meet and right, O, Master Pantocrator, Lord of all. Compassionate Father, and God of as consolation. You are the means. You are the power. You are our help. You are the Physician and refuge, the steadfast fortress and the hope of those who seek Him.

Ù…Ø³ØªØ­Ù‚ ÙˆØ¹Ø§Ø¯Ù„. Ù…Ø³ØªØ­Ù‚ ÙˆØ¹Ø§Ø¯Ù„. Ù…Ø³ØªØ­Ù‚ ÙˆØ¹Ø§Ø¯Ù„. Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ø¶Ø§Ø¨Ø· Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„ ÙˆØ±Ø¨ Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„ Ø£Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø£Ù?Ø§Øª ÙˆØ¥Ù„Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„ Ø¹Ø²Ø§Ø¡. Ø§Ù†Øª Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ³ÙŠÙ„Ø© Ø§Ù†Øª Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆØ©. Ø§Ù†Øª Ù…Ø¹ÙŠÙ†Ù†Ø§ØŒ Ø§Ù†Øª Ù‡Ùˆ Ø¹ÙˆÙ†Ù†Ø§. Ø§ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø·Ø¨ÙŠØ¨ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„ØªØ¬Ù‰Ø¡. ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­ØµÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø«Ø§Ø¨Øª ÙˆØ±Ø¬Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„ØªØ¬Ø¦ÙŠÙ† Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡.

The grace, the ascension, the hope, the life, and the resurrection. We all await Your salvation, which You reconciled everyone with. You are the head of all chiefs: the Lord of lords: the Master of masters: and the King of kings.

Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¹Ù…Ø© ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ø±ØªÙ‚Ø§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø±Ø¬Ø§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­ÙŠØ§Ø© ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠØ§Ù…Ø©. ÙˆÙ†Ø­Ù† ÙƒÙ„Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù†ØªØ¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø®Ù„Ø§ØµÙƒ Ø§Ù„Ø°Ù‰ Ø£ØµÙ„Ø­Øª Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„ Ø£Ø­Ø¯. Ø£Ù†Øª Ù‡Ùˆ Ø±Ø¦ÙŠØ³ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¤Ø³Ø§Ø¡ ÙˆØ±Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¨Ø§Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆØ³ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø§Ø¯Ø§Øª ÙˆÙ…Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„ÙˆÙƒ.

You have given the authority to those whom You have called by Your grace to bound and remit. You have given the wisdom to those who chant unto You in the Church of Your Christ: that You, as Good, have kept: for You are Almighty, and Pantocrator from the beginning. And unto You we ascribe kingdom, power, glory and majesty, with the Holy Spirit.

Holy, Holy, Holy. O Lord our God. O our King, grant us now the grace of this service, as You granted Your servant Moses, and commanded him to make the dome and the ark, according to the designs which You have shown, and he saw. And Aaron, whom You chose, and Bezalel to adorn the dome,

Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³ Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³ Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ÙŠÙ‚Ø© Ø£ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„Ù‡Ù†Ø§. Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ù† Ø§Ø¹Ø·Ù†Ø§ Ø§ÙŠØ¶Ø§ ÙŠØ§ Ù…Ù„ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ù†Ø¹Ù…Ø© Ù‡Ø°Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø¯Ù…Ø© ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ø§Ø¹Ø·ÙŠØª Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯Ùƒ Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ ÙˆØ§Ù…Ø±ØªÙ‡ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØµÙ†Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¨Ø© ÙˆØ§Ù„ØªØ§Ø¨ÙˆØªØŒ ÙƒØ§Ù„Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‰ Ù…Ø«Ù„ØªÙ‡Ø§ Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‰ Ø±Ø¢Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ø§Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø°Ù‰ Ø§Ø®ØªØ±ØªÙ‡ ÙˆØ¨ØµÙ„Ø¦ÙŠÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø°Ù‰ Ø²ÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¨Ø©ØŒ

and Solomon whom You heard his prayers in the Temple which he built for You, according to the covenant which You have settled with the pious king David, and the blessed Apostles, whom You have given the grace of the Church, and the mystery of the New Testament. We also, Your servants, whom we are not worthy, accept unto You our supplications for this holy basin, and send upon it the rays of Your grace.

Comment.Language: The priest blesses the water with the cross and the congregation responds after each time saying: Amen.
ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„ÙƒØ§Ù‡Ù† Ùˆ ÙŠØ±Ø´Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø§Ø¡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØµÙ„ÙŠØ¨ Ùˆ ÙŠØ¬Ø§ÙˆØ¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø¹Ø¨ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ù†ØªÙ‡Ø§Ø¡ Ù…Ù† ÙƒÙ„ Ø±Ø´Ù…: Ø¢Ù…ÙŠÙ†.

Text.Language: Sanctify it, Amen.
Ù‚Ø¯Ø³Ù‡Ø§. Ø£Ù…Ù€Ù€ÙŠÙ†.
Fill it with Your Holy Spirit, Amen.
Ø§Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦Ù‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø±ÙˆØ­ Ù‚Ø¯Ø³Ùƒ. Ø£Ù…Ù€Ù€ÙŠÙ†.
Put in it the seal of salvation, Amen.
Ø¶Ø¹ Ù?ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø®Ø§ØªÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ø§Øµ. Ø£Ù…Ù€Ù€ÙŠÙ†.
Your unseen power, Amen.
ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆØªÙƒ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø±Ø¦ÙŠØ© . Ø£Ù…Ù€Ù€ÙŠÙ†.
Fill it from Your divine glory, Amen.
Ø§Ù…Ù„Ø£Ù‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø¬Ø¯ Ù„Ø§Ù‡ÙˆØªÙƒ. Ø£Ù…Ù€Ù€ÙŠÙ†.
May it be a basin of blessing, Amen.
ÙˆÙ„ØªÙƒÙ† Ù?Ø³Ù‚ÙŠØ© Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø±ÙƒØ©. Ø£Ù…Ù€Ù€ÙŠÙ†.
A basin of glory and honor for Your holy name, Amen.
Ù?Ø³Ù‚ÙŠØ© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¬Ø¯ ÙˆØ§Ù„ÙƒØ±Ø§Ù…Ø© Ù„Ø§Ø³Ù…Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³. Ø£Ù…Ù€Ù€ÙŠÙ†.

O Lord Jesus Christ, who enlightened on those who where in the depths, by the appearance in flesh, and saved them from the tyranny of Satan, and revealed unto us the freedom of Your divine mystery, without corruption. You led us to Your holies, this which the angels have desired to see, and did not see. You granted unto us the entrance to the kingdom of heaven

through bathing one more time. For You said: â€œUnless one is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.â€? For this You graciously were baptized in the Jordan, and granted us purity, for You are All-holy. You purified and blessed the water when You went into it, and destroyed the heads of the dragon upon the water. We also,

ÙˆÙ†Ø­Ù† Ø§ÙŠØ¶Ø§Ù‹
who enjoyed sin with them, grant us the forgiveness of our sins and falls, by bathing in it.
Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ØªÙ†Ø¹Ù…Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø¹Ù‡Ù… Ù?Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø·ÙŠØ¦Ø©ØŒ Ù†Ù†Ø§Ù„ Ù…ØºÙ?Ø±Ø© Ø®Ø·Ø§ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø§ ÙˆØ²Ù„Ø§ØªÙ†Ø§ Ø¨Ø­Ù…ÙŠÙ…Ù†Ø§ Ù?ÙŠÙ‡.

Now also, we entreat You, O Lord, and ask of You for this basin placed like the Jordan, for our salvation , in which You were baptized by Your servant John. By Your will , O God, bless this water, so that everyone who bathes in, deserves the forgiveness of his/her sins, incorruption, and a heavenly gift, and may their names be written in the Book of Life,

with the rest of Your chosen saints, according to the will of Your good Father, and the Holy Spirit, the Life-Giver, so that they may bless You and glorify You always, for Your holy name is full of glory with Your unblemished Father and the Holy Spirit, now and ever and unto the ages of all ages. now and ever and unto the age of ages. Amen.

Comment.Language: The eldest priest wets the end of the cloak with the ""holy water," and washes the feet of his fellow priests, deacons, and then the congregation.

Our Lord Jesus Christ: gave a sign to His apostles: to love one another: a perfect love.

When He had perfected: His signs and miracles on earth: He gave them a covenant: to love humbleness.

When He poured water: in a basin and washed their feet: He ordered them saying: â€˜You also do likewiseâ€™.

He was crucified on the wood of the Cross: and was stabbed with a spear in His right side: blood and water came flowing: to purify the believers.

He died and was put in the tomb: and rose on the third day: ascended into the heavens: and sat on the right hand of His Father.

His disciples remained on earth: until Pentecost: and the Spirit, the Comforter: came down upon them.

They spoke in a heavenly language: and the tune of angels: and they revealed the name of God: and His Life-giving miracles.

After they had received the Spirit: they fasted also: as their Master: fasted on earth.

And after their fast was completed: they made the sign: which He gave them: I mean humility and perfect love.

And also Peter: who succeded our Lord Jesus: has poured water in the basin: and washed their feet.

ÙˆØ¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ù…Ø´ÙˆØ§ ÙˆØ¨Ø´Ø±ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ£Ù…Ø± Ù…Ø®Ù„ØµÙ†Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ¹Ù…Ø¯ÙˆØ§ Ø¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø³ Ø¨Ø§Ø³Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø«Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ« Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³.

We thank You, O Lord God, the giver of all good things and all beneficence. Who made us also now worthy, for this holy service which is Yours, to be in communion with the love of Your only-begotten Son, our Lord, God, and Savior, Jesus Christ; according to His holy commandments. Keep us all by the power of Your Holy Spirit. Grant to thank You at all times.

By the grace, compassion and philanthropy, of Your only-begotten Son, our Lord, God and Savior, Jesus Christ. Through whom the glory, the honor, the dominion, and the adoration are due unto You, with Him, and the Holy Spirit, the Life-Giver, who is of one essence with You, now, and at all times, and unto the age of all ages. Amen.
